meanings.sent1: The children were so rumbustious during recess that the teacher had to intervene.
meanings.sent2: The party became rumbustious as more guests arrived and the music got louder.
meanings.sent3: The rumbustious puppy knocked over the flower pot while chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside was as rumbustious as a wild horse galloping through the fields.
meanings.sent5: The rumbustious laughter of the friends echoed through the park.

meanings.definition: Characterized by noisy and rough play or behavior
meanings.sent1: The rumbustious puppies were rolling around in the mud, barking happily.
meanings.sent2: The street was filled with the rumbustious sounds of children playing games.
meanings.sent3: The rumbustious kittens chased each other around the room, knocking over everything in their path.
meanings.sent4: The old truck made a rumbustious noise as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The rumbustious waves crashed against the shore, creating a symphony of sound.

meanings.sent1: The rumbustious crowd at the concert pushed and shoved to get closer to the stage.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was filled with rumbustious chatter as the students worked on group projects.
meanings.sent3: The rumbustious squirrels in the park stole snacks from unsuspecting picnickers.
meanings.sent4: The rumbustious wind blew the leaves in all directions, creating a chaotic dance.
meanings.sent5: The rumbustious market was a whirlwind of activity, with vendors shouting their prices.
